tweets.text: RT @hubermanlab: Brilliant, informative and important discussion between @lexfridman and @profvrr about viruses, and vaccines. They cover t…
My brain told me to tweet this. I wonder what it will tell me to do next. I'm excited by all the possibilities.
RT @profvrr: My three and one half hour conversation about viruses with @lexfridman was amazing - please check it out. Longer than an episo…

Here's my conversation with Vincent Racaniello (@profvrr), a virologist and microbiologist at Columbia, co-host of This Week in Virology, and one of best educators of biology and science that I've ever spoken to. We talk all about viruses and vaccines. https://t.co/JjHX5NI6Ee https://t.co/szCvZAVirb

Some tech podcasts I love:

For the storytelling:
Darknet Diaries
w/ @JackRhysider

For the friendship & insights:

w/ @Jason @chamath @DavidSacks @friedberg

For the AI wisdom:

Here's my conversation with Wojciech Zaremba (@woj_zaremba), co-founder of OpenAI and head of their efforts on language models (GPT-3), code generation, and previously, robotics. Wojciech is brilliant and is a great human being. I really enjoyed this chat. https://t.co/o15RKM6ao8 https://t.co/QOrAUzTQeC

Andrew Huberman (@hubermanlab) took his first jiu jitsu class w/ me at 10th Planet in Austin while visiting. As the picture shows, I think it went well. It's great to see a world-class scientist humbly take on a new challenge with a beginner's mind. Video: https://t.co/8QuLEdcO2b https://t.co/4F0Heykyqq

Here's my conversation with Jed Buchwald, a historian and philosopher of science at Caltech. We focus our conversation on Isaac Newton, one of the most important and fascinating figures in human history. https://t.co/x60VWzGnQg https://t.co/qE3Q7EziaP

Education is about more than memorization. Learning & practicing general principles of problem solving is more important than memorizing the techniques of how to solve specific problems. https://t.co/UsHsef7fjf
